text:
August 21, 2023 
M
EMORANDUM  FOR:  The General  Public 
FROM:  ANDREW LEVINSON, MPH  
Director  
Directorate of Standards  and Guidance  
S
UBJECT:  Reopening of the Comment Period  on Docket  No. OSHA-2021-0009 to  Allow  for 
Submission of Documents and Comments 
The purpose of this memorandum is to notify interested  parties  that the Occupational Safety  and 
Health Administration (OSHA) is reopening the comment period on Docket No. 
OSHA-2021-0009 to allow additional time for interested stakeholders to submit comments on its  
Small Business Advocacy Review  (SBAR)  Panel  materials.  
C
omments on this docket will be accepted from 08/18/2023 to 12/23/2023. OSHA welcomes 
comments from all interested parties on the potential regulatory framework for a potential rule 
addressing heat injury and illness prevention in outdoor and indoor work settings, the 
alternatives and options that OSHA is considering, prelimin ary analysis of the unit costs of the 
framework, or any other aspect of the materials presented herein. Additional background 
information can be found on OSHA’s  Heat Injury and Illness  SBREFA  website  at 
https://www.osha.gov/heat/sbrefa .  
You may submit comments, identified by Docket No. OSHA-2021-0009, the following method:  
•Electronically : You may  submit materials,  including attachments,  electronically  at
http://www.regulations.gov, which  is the Federal  eRulemaking Portal.  Follow the online
instructions for making submissions.
O
SHA will post your comments in the docket, without change, including any personal 
information that you provide. Therefore, OSHA cautions interested parties about submitting 
personal information such as Social Security numbers and birthdates. To read or download documents in this docket, go to Docket No. OSHA-2021-0009 at http://www.regulations.gov. 
The index for that Webpage lists all documents in the docket; however, some documents (e.g., copyrighted materials) are not publicly available through that Webpage. All documents in the assigned docket, including materials not available through http://www.regulations.gov, are 
available in the OSHA Docket  Office.  Please contact  the OSHA Docket  Office for assistance in 
making submissions to, o r obtaining materials from, this docket.  
Occupational  Safety  and Health  Administration 
Washington, D.C. 20210  
Should you have  any general  questions  regarding this memorandum, please contact  Jessica  Stone 
at (202) 693- 1847 or via email at stone.jessica@dol.gov. For press inquiries, please contact Mr. 
Frank Meilinger, Director, OSHA Office of Communications at telephone (202) 693- 1999 (TTY 
(877) 889- 5627) or via e mail at meilinger.francis2@dol.gov.
